item.title: Pump Low PRESS Indication Systems – Left Pump Indication Systems – Pump Operative

numlitem.para: Associated low SYS PRESS Light is operative, and
Associated pump is verified to be operative before each departure.
Select operable HYD Pumps ON and verify SYS PRESS Lights extinguished before each flight.

placard.para: Placard affected Hydraulic Pump Low PRESS light(s) on Hydraulic Control panel "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Pump Low Press Lights

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)
THE FOLLOWING PROCEDURE MUST BE ACCOMPLISHED PRIOR TO EACH FLIGHT.

maintenance.para: Check affected pump operation as follows:

caution.para: TO PREVENT HYDRAULIC FLUID OVERHEAT, DO NOT OPERATE PUMPS WITHOUT MINIMUM QUANTITIES OF FUEL IN TANKS. (600 GALLONS/4020 POUNDS IN EACH MAIN TANK.

note.para: EDP = Engine Driven Pump; EMP = Electric Motor Pump

numlitem.para: Right engine driven pump:
Ensure personnel are clear of flight controls.
With right engine running, select R System EDP ON and EMP OFF.
HYD PRESS reading EICAS must be 2850 to 3150 psig.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

note.para: When running the right engine EDP, the PTU will come on pressurizing the FLAP/SLAT and LANDING GEAR circuits. The PTU can be deactivated by pulling circuit breakers D31 on panel P11 before engine start.

numlitem.para: Left engine driven pump and PTU control logic verification:

note.para: The PTU portion of the L EDP Low PRESS Switch must be operative for dispatch.

numlitem.para: With the flaps in the up position, select left and right engines off.
Ensure PTU circuit breaker (11D31) is closed.
Select right system pumps on (EMP and EDP).
Select left system EDP on and EMP off.
Start right engine.
Verify left system pressure on EICAS is ≥ 2850 psi.
Start left engine.
Verify left system pressure on EICAS is ≥ 2850 psi.
Pull PTU circuit breaker (11D31) to remove power from PTU control valve.
Select left EDP off.
Select flaps 1.
Verify left system pressure on EICAS is ≤ 1500 psi. TE FLAP DISAGREE on EICAS occurs.
Turn left system EDP on and select flaps up.
Verify left system pressure on EICAS is ≥ 2850 psi.
Arm and disarm alternate flaps to clear EICAS TE FLAP DISAGREE.
Reset PTU circuit breaker (11D31).
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
Alternating current motor pump:
Ensure that personnel are clear of flight controls.
With electrical power on aircraft, press affected HYD PUMPS ELEC Switch to ON.
HYD PRESS reading on EICAS must be 2850 to 3150 psig.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

note.para: The pump being tested must be the only pump operating within the related hydraulic system at the time of the test. This test may be accomplished by the flight crew in coordination with AMC.
